Building capacity and expertise in the aviation sector in Africa is critical for improving air traffic connectivity and achieving economic growth and regional integration. Here are some ways to build capacity and expertise in the sector:

1. Training and education programs: Governments and private sector organizations can invest in training and education programs for aviation professionals, including air traffic controllers, maintenance technicians, and airport managers. This will help build the skills and knowledge needed to implement new technologies and systems, and to maintain high safety standards.
2. Partnerships with international organizations: African countries can form partnerships with international organizations, such as the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) and the International Air Transport Association (IATA), to access expertise, training, and best practices.
3. Encouraging private sector investment: The private sector can play an important role in building capacity and expertise in the aviation sector, including by investing in training programs for employees and establishing partnerships with universities and research institutions.
4. Support for research and innovation: Governments and private sector organizations can invest in research and innovation aimed at improving air traffic management systems, including the development of new technologies and approaches.
5. Building a strong regulatory framework: A strong and effective regulatory framework is also critical for building capacity and expertise in the aviation sector. This includes having clear rules and standards for air traffic management, licensing and certifying airlines and other aviation operators, and enforcing safety standards.

Overall, building capacity and expertise in the aviation sector requires a multi-faceted approach, including investments in education and training, partnerships with international organizations, private sector investment, support for research and innovation, and the establishment of a strong regulatory framework.
